    level="1"
    right="Item 8"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Encompassing Lockpick](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1240)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Extradimensional" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=67" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 10</row>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) Due to their connection to the shop’s proprietor, all Pathfinder Society agents have access to the items from Barghest’s Bin_

**Price** 450 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This lockpick houses a small compartment containing many smaller picks and other miniature tools. The lockpick itself is surprisingly malleable, belying the components within. An almost-impossible number of other tools are hidden in the compartment, including an entire set of [infiltrator thieves' tools](/Equipment.aspx?ID=58) and any replacement picks, an [elite disguise kit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=19) and any replacement cosmetics, and an [extreme climber's kit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=14), all while still somehow remaining only light Bulk. This makes the _encompassing lockpick_ a favorite discreet option for rogues infiltrating high society events, as formal wear generally has few pockets and only allows a character to wear a single tool kit of light Bulk.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
